Chapter.Title: Chapter 1-Canard-‘I go out to the street, my hands in my pockets.’

Dialog.Content: I still cannot leave this place…
Even at the end of all this, I cannot be free…
Am I not allowed to have a dream that is beyond my means…?
Damn it… The Purple Tear…
Can’t believe this is how she handled it…
What the hell happened? What’s with all this smoke?
Sigh… Guess I’ll have to trust her…
…I’ll only say this once.
I despise verbose and roundabout speech that doesn’t get straight to the point.
So don’t try to get wordy. Just answer my questions.
You don’t get to question me, either.
Where did you come from, how did you enter this place, and for what purpose?

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: Well, who are you to…

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: Ugh, boy… I’m suddenly getting all nauseous…

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: AHHHHHH!!! My leg!!!
I warned you, and you crossed the line. Let me ask you one more time.
Where did you come from, how did you enter this place, and for what purpose?

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: …I was just walking around, and ended up here before I even realized it. I have no idea how I got here. Dammit, blood’s gushing outta my right leg… I swear I wasn’t trying to trespass, I don’t even know where this is.

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: I woke up around 1 PM and started walking around the streets of District 13. Since I was just out and about, I figured I could go wherever I wanted, so I decided to drop by HamHamPangPang. Heard they served a weekly special sandwich.

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: Anyway, I had bills to pay, got no jobs, had to make a living somehow as a one-man Offi—

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: ARGHHHHH!!!!!
You dragged on too long. I’ll be taking your left arm and left leg next.
You have no purpose, and you don’t even know how you got here… Just who are you?

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: Just an ordinary Fixer who’s hit rock bottom. What the hell is this place? And who are you?

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: Grrhhhhrhghh!!! Come on, taking two limbs at once is cheating…
I’m the one asking questions. Your name?

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: Roland…
Good. Welcome to the Library. We’ve yet to serve any guests, but then you suddenly appeared out of nowhere.
It took me quite a bit of effort designing this Library to ensure that no uninvited guest could enter, you see.

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: …Dammit, these limbs were all I had… I don’t have any cash or mortgages to get new ones anymore…
Seems he’s fainted.
Wake up.

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: Gasp! Huff, huff… My legs! My arms!!

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: …Wait, they’re all intact again?
You should be able to swing your arms and walk again.
And I made a few readjustments to your body to make it a bit easier to use.
Although you did trespass on my Library, I also took your limbs away without your consent, so I’m giving you these as an apology.
I’m quite patient and generous, you see.

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: Patient, my ass… Am I really supposed to be thankful for this?

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: And the, uhh… your warning isn’t in effect anymore, right?
Nope, not anymore. I had a few thoughts while you were knocked out.
And here’s my conclusion: You’ll help me out here.

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: What? Huh? Do Syndicates these days kidnap people this way, too? Or, is this one of the Wings?

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: I heard rumors that they abduct test subjects from here and there for Singularity research.

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: An acquaintance of mine apparently began jumping between dimensions as a side effect of one of those experiments…

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: Sigh… My life really is an unlucky mess.
This is a library. I don’t know the “Syndicates” you’re talking about, but this place isn’t a Wing at least.

Dialog.Title: Intruder
Dialog.Content: Doesn’t really matter. Whatever the case, I’m trapped here and you’ll exploit me, right?
Yes. I am letting you live for two reasons.
First, I need an analysis of how you could enter this place uninvited.
Sending you back or neglecting you without knowing the reason could pose a significant threat to the Library.
Well, it’s not like you can leave without my permission anymore.
Second, from now on, I will collect books about the City in search of the one absolute book.
And I want you to help me with this process.
Since you are a resident of the City, I expect you to be helpful in various ways.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …I knew this would happen to me someday. People would disappear without a trace, only to be found as chunks of flesh much later…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I used to laugh at those poor folks for being careless and unlucky, but now I see it has nothing to do with carelessness or anything, huh. Just happens without a moment’s notice…
Don’t be too concerned about your life. You are not allowed to die here unless I permit you to.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Dammit, so this was a crazy laboratory sort of deal.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Do you, like, shove random stuff like corn kernels and clockwork into people’s stomachs and turn them into walking popcorn-spewing popcorn-machine-men or something?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: This has got to be the worst… I’d much rather die and be over with it all…
If you spout such nonsense one more time, I’ll gladly turn you into a human popcorn machine as you so wish.
I’ve already gone through so many cycles of bullshittery, responding to every bit of meaningless rubbish.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sorry, ma’am…
Let me introduce myself properly.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: My name is Angela. I am the head librarian and director of this library.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Ange…la… That’s a good name.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So, what am I supposed to do?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Your role is to “welcome” the guests invited to the Library.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I will carefully determine what guests to invite and write an invitation accordingly, and you will entertain the guests once they accept the invitation and arrive at the Library.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Since you have actual experience working as a Fixer, I am sure you will be able to give the various types of guests a much better reception than I could.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m just a washed-up Grade 9 Fixer, though…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What’s this “reception” all about anyway? Do I catch their eyes, or be a waiter for them or something?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s simple. You just have to deal with the guests. In a physical manner, of course.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The Library presents the guests with an ordeal, and books will open up in the process.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The guests who have overcome the ordeal will be deemed worthy to earn their books.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: There is the possibility that you may die in the process of reception, but it’s only temporary. You’ll get back up when the Library closes.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: No one here may rest without my permission.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Do you happen to have some weird fantasies about Fixers? Aren’t you expecting too much from a Grade 9? I’m not as talented as you seem to think, y’know.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s none of my business. I have prepared a manual for you, so go ahead and figure things out yourself.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I think I get the gist of it now. So, how does this invitation exactly work?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Open up the invitation, and register the books you wish to serve to your guests.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And next?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The invitation will be naturally sent to those who need the books.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s it? Sounds a bit too easy.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The invitation is another carefully crafted work of mine, much like the Library.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yes, think of it as a compass. It would be easier to understand that way.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Ah~ A compass? As in the tool that tells directions?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s right. The invitations will guide me towards the one book that I truly wish to obtain.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And sometimes, the invitation may turn red according to the books you’ve registered.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: A red invitation indicates that it can be sent to the special guests who will unravel the next part of the story.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Until we register the books that match what the red invitation wants, our journey will be halted for a bit.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But there’s no guarantee that the guest will always respond to the invitation, right?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: In fact, there is. They’re destined to come.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And the guests will accept the invitation of their own will and enter the Library.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s surprisingly polite and fair for something that takes place in this city.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Most of the time, people’s lives are taken away by others without any consent or agreement.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, anyway, once we get those books, what comes next?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The Library is a place of limitless possibilities.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Even I cannot fathom the infinite space and power of this library just yet.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s why I wish to complete the Library by filling that space with books.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And I will get in my hands the one perfect book that will complete me and my library.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The perfect book, huh… I suppose those “books” are different from the ones I know.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Guess the books here are not exactly the kind I’m familiar with, huh.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The books in this Library are special, as they’re made from humans.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: These books show the reader what they want to see.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What a book can show is finite to the information the original person had, so it has its limits. Still, its value can vary greatly depending on who reads it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Information… Now that reeks of money. Would attract a whole bunch of bugs, too.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Hey! Hurry up and scrape them up, now! Those Zwei goons might arrive any second!

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: I’m doing my best here!

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: I just can’t seem to get a clean rip of his guts, the contents of this guy are weirdly different.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: I’ve never even heard of a body modification procedure that does this…

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Something’s off about these organs. They’re looking really strange…

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Damn it! Their footsteps are getting closer.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Forget about clean cuts, just pull ‘em out and take ‘em!!

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: At this rate, our heads are gonna get nicely chopped offa our bodies.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Why does he have this kinda stuff in his body…

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Whatever, just take ‘em! We’re out of time!

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Just about done!

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Now, run!

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Phew… That was close.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: You’re a bold one, Pete. Going for a gut-harvest in a territory managed by the Zwei.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: These are the only jobs we have left.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: We have to climb up by any means necessary. Whatever it takes…

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: You know my dream, right? To become one of the Fingers of the Backstreets.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: I’ll admit, it’s rare to see someone with a dream these days.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Let’s sell off these guts we’ve hauled first.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: We gotta prepare enough cash to offer to the Stray Dogs.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: True… This could be our chance to join an Urban Legend-class Syndicate…

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Alright, time to check out the harvest.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Hey! Is this a joke? You sure you scraped up the right stuff?!

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: I told you. This guy didn’t have a single proper organ inside him.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: I expected innards soaked in drugs like Enkephalin at worst…

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: These are damaged too badly. It’s almost like someone already blew them up.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: We only doused him with anesthetics. Didn’t do no harm.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: This doesn’t make sense… How could he have even walked around with these messed up organs…

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: …What if it’s one of those? Y’know, rumors say there’s a guy who skewers and threads people alive to turn them into dolls…

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Yeah, I’ve heard of that, too. But look at the state of these things! Not the case at all.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: I hear those dolls are made by threading flesh and bones together. But this sonofabitch didn’t have any scars or stitches showing outside!

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: …Now that I think about it, there was a round orange symbol on the back of his neck.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: I thought it was a tattoo at first, but he didn’t seem like the type to have one. He was a desk-working dweeb.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Symbols? Tattoos? Damn it, please don’t tell me we poked the wrong beehive…

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Besides that…

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: He also had this envelope in his body.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: What the hell is an envelope doing in a human body?! This keeps getting worse… Gimme that!

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: An invitation to a library? What’s this about…

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Books? We can get books from the library? What a bunch of nonsense.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: It was a flop after all. …The payment is due tomorrow.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: We’ve got 7 hours, to be exact. That’s too little time for another run of gut-harvesting…

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: …We’re heading to the library as the invitation says.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: I don’t know what this ‘book’ thing is, but we’re out of options. We gotta take any chance we get.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Isn’t this just suicide? We don’t know what kinda place it might be.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Can’t be any worse than dying to the Stray Dogs or the Zwei Association; we’re screwed anyway! Shut up and follow me if you want to live.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Inside the Library - 1st Invitation Sent

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What was that we just saw…?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Fragments of the invitation process.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: We can take a peek at the stories of our upcoming guests.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Didn’t take you for a peeping tom.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s more convenient to know what kind of guests will visit us in advance, isn’t it?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Besides, this is the invitation’s will, not mine.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s a splendid thing you got there, ma’am. Pries upon people and kidnaps them, too. A perfect tool for crimes.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Heck, if the invitation can do all that, why don’t we just skip the whole reception part?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Can’t we just teleport them right into a room full of traps or something?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I cannot do that. We can only take a peek when it has been decided that the guests are coming here of their own volition.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And the invitation’s power isn’t wholly mine, either. I am simply borrowing it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah yeah, no way anything can go so smoothly in the City.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They’re desperate guests.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Tell me, was the invitation responsible for that symbol and internal damage as well?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What? Not a chance, it doesn’t have anything to do with what happened.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The invitation simply finds a way to those who need it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That means those weird happenings were someone else’s doing…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’ve never seen that kind of phenomenon back when I was a Fixer. It’s like something from the Ruins…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Ruins?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …I don’t know a whole lot, either. I only heard stories of it. Should I describe it as… magic?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That kind of stuff exists in the Ruins, apparently.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: In any case, we simply greet our guests. They seem to be low class, but oh well.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Those are probably a bunch of lowly gangsters from the Backstreets. We call them ‘Rats’.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Groups of half-assed thugs that barely qualify as a Syndicate. They don’t have money or power.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They’re losers who only think about making ends meet day by day.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hmm… I might have just roasted myself here.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The Backstreets… I know of them.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You do?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Someone I know was from the Backstreets.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, that’s nothing special, really. The Backstreets stretch all over the city like veins.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Heck, it might actually be tougher to find someone who isn’t from the Backstreets.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: So this is a library. Looks fancier than I thought.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Could be a bunch of valuable things here.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests. This is the Library.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And I am Angela, the librarian of my role’s namesake.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You may find what you desire here, but you also may end up yielding your precious possessions to us.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: You the owner of this place? We’re allowed to take whatever we want here, right?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Indeed. You may earn books, to be exact.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If you’re able, of course.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Are those book things really worth a lot, though…?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Of course they can be, if the information they hold is valuable.

Dialog.Title: Rat
Dialog.Content: Mang-chi! Beggars can’t be choosers. We gotta cling on to anything we can find.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place, then.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I wonder, is it so important for them to belong to a renowned Syndicate?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s all part of the City life. You have to belong to a group, be it a Syndicate or anything else. Living in the City gets too tough otherwise.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: Y-you guys should regularly refill your head with brain fluid.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: A-a dry brain dulls your thoughts.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: I-I knew I’ve been feeling so hazy these days.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: W-where are we going to rob this time?

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: I-I think we should go for a workshop. W-workshops are rich, and they have useful components, too.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: H-how about an Office? W-we should earn some infamy if we take down an Office or two.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: I-I don’t think we’ll get anything valuable from the Offices we can take on right now.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: A-a restaurant, then! I-I like delicious stuff.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: Y-you moron. D-did you already forget why we got our new bodies?!

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: B-because we wanted to focus on earning without having to worry about food or sickness.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: T-that’s right. W-we’re enduring like crazy.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: T-these bodies just need brain fluid, fuel, and some repairs from time to time.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: W-we can make money without feeling hungry or thirsty.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: T-that’s true. I-it cost a fortune to get ourselves whole-body replacements.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: B-but it’s still uncomfortable. I-I know I don’t have to eat anymore, but I keep thinking about all the tasty things I had before, and it makes me want to taste them again.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: T-that’s because we got cheap bodies from a cheap workshop.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: W-we just have to earn more. T-then we can replace our bodies with better ones.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: T-the most expensive ones can even adjust emotions and completely shut off desires, on top of having good performance…

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: B-but those are almost as expensive as a Nest household.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: W-we can worry about that later. L-let’s focus on money-making now.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: I-it’s all about money in the end.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: S-so don’t bring up restaurants. Y-you’re making me want to eat stuff, too.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: M-Mo…! T-there’s a piece of paper stuck in your body.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: I-I like how this body doesn’t have any sensory systems, but i-it’s annoying to be unable to feel things like this.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: L-let’s have a look at that piece of paper first.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: I-I don’t think it was in your body until just now.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: M-maybe we got too infamous and someone sent us a calling card or something?

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: O-or maybe a coupon for yummy new food…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Are all Syndicates composed of such half-witted individuals? I was expecting someone more refined.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It all depends on the Syndicate. The City is crowded with them. You could even say there’s one for every Fixer out there.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: A number of thugs gather up and do things under a name, and you get a Syndicate.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They’re involved in all sorts of different businesses, so it’s hard to give a general description beyond that.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They seem sloppy. Are those machines?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They aren’t machines or AI, despite their appearance.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Pure machines carrying their own emotions and desires have long since disappeared from the City.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: These guys are just using whole-body replacements. And low-quality ones from a shoddy workshop at that…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I see.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright! Shall we prepare for the reception?

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: S-so we can find valuable stuff here, right?

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: W-we just have to chop up some monsters and take some books.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: T-this body has strength if nothing else.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: W-we came here for loot, but what if that piece of paper was all a lie?

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: M-maybe we were too naive.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: There is no need to worry, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: In this place, we strictly play by the rules written on the invitation.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: Y-yikes.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Welcome, dear guests. This is the Library.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And I am Angela, the director and librarian of my role’s namesake.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: In this library, you may obtain the books listed on the invitation. If you overcome the ordeal, that is.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: M-must be one of those ploys by rich folks. I-it’s all entertainment to them.

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: I-I heard of that, t-they kidnap people from the Backstreets, trap them in a labyrinth no one can escape, and make them wander in there, fighting for eternity…

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: U-until they die, never to see light again…

Dialog.Title: Brother of Iron
Dialog.Content: W-we’ve already come this far, we have to do this. D-don’t be so gloomy.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place, then.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: See, it’s not a good idea to keep your brain inside a hunk of scrap metal.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Isn’t it still better than a frail human body though?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There are plenty of ways to enhance your body without replacing it for another.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Heck, there’s actually many options. Tattoos, prosthetic limbs, medications and drugs, you name it. It’s all possible as long as you have the cash.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Replacing your body with a machine, on the other hand, is a one-way ticket you can’t ever go back on.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Robotic bodies cannot resemble humans too closely, even if it’s for someone swapping out their flesh. Your life goes down the drain right away.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: When does one put their brain in a machine, then?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: One, when you urgently need a huge amount of money. You can sell off your old body and organs for a good chunk of cash.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Two, when you need to do repetitive work for a long time. I heard mechanical bodies like that aren’t bad for that kind of labor.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Broken parts can be quickly replaced, and desires can be kept under control, so it has its merits.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Repetitive work for a long time…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What, interested in getting a new body?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: No, I was just reminded of my past for a moment.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Office
Dialog.Content: Foiled again. I didn’t go through all the trouble of becoming a Fixer to do mundane chores like this.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Office
Dialog.Content: You know how it is. Only a select few get to rise up in the ranks.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: But still, we might see the light one day if we start out with smaller tasks, don’t you think?

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Office
Dialog.Content: I envy your optimism, Finn.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Office
Dialog.Content: But a request like “Please find my lost cat before night falls” is seriously not it.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Office
Dialog.Content: Garbage Offices get garbage requests.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Office
Dialog.Content: Yeah, Finn. You probably had better things in mind when you became a Fixer.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Office
Dialog.Content: Y’know, a bigger field to play on.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: I’m sure I can move to a nicer Office or become an Associate Fixer someday if I keep working hard. Then I might…

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: That’s odd… There’s this envelope in my pocket. It says ‘The Invitation’.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Office
Dialog.Content: Smells fishy.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Office
Dialog.Content: Can’t overlook something like this.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Office
Dialog.Content: Besides, if what’s written on the invitation is true, those “books” would be of interest to several Associations.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: It is interesting, but… We don’t exactly know what’s in the library, right?

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: We should report this to the Office first and take care of it formally.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Office
Dialog.Content: I ain’t about to feed a garbage Office that won’t feed me. We’re going first if you don’t wanna.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They called themselves Fixers; do you happen to be friends with them?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What? Look, assuming all Fixers know each other is…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s like picking two random pedestrians and hoping they know each other.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Your question is basically asking these two strangers, “You’re both humans, so you must know each other, right?” You get what I mean?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh… I should expect to see many different kinds of Fixers if what you’re saying is true.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Pretty much.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: Sir, they still haven’t responded back to us.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: Something must have happened in that ‘Library’.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: Plenty of Fixers disappear without a trace.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: Whether they died or ran off, further lack of response means a violation of contract, and they’re facing expulsion from my Office.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: And there is too little evidence to back up your claim about this “invitation”.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: A door appeared out of thin air when they signed the paper, and they disappeared into that? Could be rich people’s shenanigans, or a Wing experimenting with its singularity.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: ‘Yun’s Office’ does not have any time to spare with things like that.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: I might still be a Grade 9 Fixer, but I can sense that something’s off about this.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: Oh really? How tragic that such good instincts of a Grade 9 Fixer are wasted on our humble Office.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: Listen up, little frog in the well. In this city, insane events happen every second of the day, most of which you haven’t even heard of.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: You won’t have time to be feeling “off” about something when there’s numerous other things that need your attention.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: If you can’t present visible evidence right now, it’s not worth looking into.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: What about that envelope right in front of you, operator?

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: …What?

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: You little brat, trying to pull a cheap trick on me?

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: …I didn’t do anything, I swear.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: Get out for a moment.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: Hey. This is Yun’s Office.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: Got a good lead this time.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: Lend me some cash so I can hire a few.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: No seriously, I have a good feeling about this.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: …True, it can end up failing like you said.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: …I can check just one more time if you want.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: I’m not exactly fond of this method, but…

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: Yep, I have one guy fit for the job.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It seems Fixers must report to their Office before they can even begin working.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, that’s formally the case. I could bypass that since I ran a one-man Office, though.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Fixers aren’t any better than Syndicates when it comes to greed.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And it looks like this guy’s trying to exploit a naive kid, too.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: So this is the Library…

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yeah, Yun said we might even get sponsorship from an Association if I succeed. I’ll do my best!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, Fixer. I am Angela, the librarian of my role’s namesake.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hello. I’m Finn, a Fixer at Yun’s Office.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Is it true that I can find “books” containing lots of information in this place?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yes, of course. You were given the invitation for that exact reason.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh boy. It’s not all that delightful to see such a young rookie fall like that, all things considered.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You said yourself that our way is quite polite and fair before, didn’t you?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That “most of the time, people’s lives are taken away by others without any consent or agreement.”

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The Library is different.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: People who enter this place have agreed to risk death to gain what they want. They even sign the paper to show such agreement.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: No coercion or compulsion is involved in this process. They make their own choice and pay accordingly.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, yeah, fair point. But still, it kinda feels dirty in a way.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: Finn has failed as expected. He wasn’t going to last too long, anyway.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: He was just mediocre. He should have gotten a decent modification surgery, or had enough talent to make up for his lack of experience.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: But he didn’t have any of that. He was nothing more than an overconfident brat.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: Too bad, I kinda liked his affable and cutesy attitude.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: Though I agree, he was bound to die sooner or later.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: Congratulations, by the way. You must have more options now that you’re a Grade 8 Fixer.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yep! So you’d better be careful. If you don’t pay me well enough, I might move to another Office.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: Heard that you’re barely covering your own taxes these days, let alone the monthly rent for this Office space, am I wrong?

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: …I believe the case I had Finn handle could make a breakthrough.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: You mean the Library and the invitation you talked about earlier.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: But you said the invitation appears randomly, no? How are you going to get another one?

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: I wouldn’t have called you if I didn’t have certainty. I recently received another invitation.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hmm. Is that so?

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: The existence of our Office depends on this case.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: The Library is sure to be profitable. I have a hunch. So we’re giving it everything we have.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: Aight, let’s roll in some dough! I just bought this lovely thing here from a workshop, too.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: These guests seem quite determined. We should prepare accordingly.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: A whole Office coming at us, huh.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It may be a small and insignificant one, but it could prove to be a little tough for the Library right now.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What if they make it all the way to your room?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The guests cannot act outside of the space we’ve prepared for them. It’s how this place works.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: After all, this space is created with limitless power.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yet you somehow jumped right into my room, when you weren’t even invited…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Anyways, I’m capable of protecting myself, so there’s nothing for you to worry about.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: You must be the owner of this place.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: She doesn’t even look that strong.

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: Finn must have been here earlier; what happened to him?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Ah, that one has become a book.

Dialog.Title: Yun’s Fixer
Dialog.Content: I see, so you turn into a book if you die here~

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Acting all sentimental when you were the one who sent him here, knowing he’d fail?

Dialog.Title: Office Operator
Dialog.Content: Shut up. We all get exploited and abandoned at some point in our lives.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Excellent. This guest named Yun could make an especially valuable book for us.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They’re all like moths diving into flames.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That Yun guy seemed like a clever sort, but even he ended up blindly jumping into the fire to get what he wanted.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: “Once you’ve had a taste of desire, it comes in like an unstoppable wave.” It’s a quote I heard a long time ago.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: But is that desire true to one’s heart…?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, aren’t you funny? You said you despise roundabout speech, and now you’re being all poetic.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Ten out of ten delivery, a certain librarian I know would have taken an arm and a leg off if she heard that.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh… Get back to sorting books.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: My whole body’s still aching from our last job.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: That’s lasting longer than I thought. Still, yesterday was wild, wasn’t it?

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yep. The new weapon you got from the workshop was a real killer, that’s for sure.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: You don’t say. You got way too excited with it and things spiraled out of control. We had to kill 20 more people than planned thanks to you.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Since it was a mistake on our part, we couldn’t even get paid for the extra kills.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Come on, don’t be such a killjoy. You’re the one who went on the biggest rampage in the end.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Macca’s muscles are all sore because he had to try hard to calm you down.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: W-well, I said I’m sorry about it…

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: No need to sweat it. I owe you guys a few things, too.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: I hate to admit it, but Taein has a point.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: We all should try to cool down our temper a little.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: As long as we’re working as Fixers, it’s not good to raise more trouble than necessary.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Former members of a killer Syndicate, now registered to an Office and doing Fixer work…

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Life really is full of surprises, isn’t it?

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: This Office is a weird one too. Can’t believe people like us are accepted.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Remember what the boss said. There are so many Offices and Fixers these days, so standing out from the others is the best way to survive in this industry.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Our outfits are also quite radical compared to what other Offices have.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: That’s why it’s filled with maniacs like us.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: All we gotta do is kill the targets in the most gruesome way possible and hang their bodies out in the open. No wonder everyone’s excited to join.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s no different from what we’ve always been doing.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: At first, I thought it was crazy that an Office would do this kinda work…

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: But I guess “threatening targets and sending them a warning” makes enough sense. It seems to be working well, too.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Though we’ve only been getting requests from no-name Syndicates and poor folk. This Office has a long way to go.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: It does feel more like a pack of Rats than a proper Office.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Got a message from the boss. Says we should drop by to get new work.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Even rascals like those can join Offices these days, huh.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The whole market’s a red ocean. Everyone wants to be a Fixer.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And that doesn’t count as raking yourself over the coals, because…?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Listen, I may not look like it, but I used to be hot stuff, y’know?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But then things happened and I fell to rock bottom.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: So, what did you do for a living?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I did all kinds of stuff, really. Doing things within my ability!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Hmm. Is that so?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That means you didn’t get to do any proper work, then.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Wow, we really did teleport in the blink of an eye.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Is this one of those Singularities?

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Lots of surprises these days.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hi there?

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: What the… She’s pretty damn sturdy. How much did you spend on that bod?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: There is no need to needlessly exhaust yourself, dear guest.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You’ll need to rampage with all you have soon enough.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: I don’t like your soft tone.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: You’re not human, are you?

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Ooh, look at her face now. Guess she really isn’t?

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yet another surprise. It’s so rare to meet a sapient being that isn’t human in this City.

Dialog.Title: Hook Fixer
Dialog.Content: I know, right? We might get a ton of cash out of this!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Great work as always. I could learn more about the Offices thanks to these guests.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I, uh… Don’t get too bothered by what they said about you, alright?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Are you trying to console me?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Maybe, maybe not… I don’t really care if you’re actually human or not, you see.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s refreshing to hear. It’s been quite a while since I heard such words of comfort. From even one person, too…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, we’re in the age of humanity, after all.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Age of humanity? What does that mean, exactly?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Don’t stare at me too hard, now… I don’t know all the details, either.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: At some point, intelligent or sapient beings that weren’t human were actively driven out of the City into the Outskirts.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m not too sure why it took place, but the Artificial Intelligence Ethics Amendment was introduced as part of that movement…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It was already possible to create machines capable of feeling emotions and desires, actually. Those that are… pretty much human, in other words.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I guess that was the problem.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Thanks to the AI Ethics Amendment, no machines could ever be made to resemble humans, including replacement bodies.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Though there seems to have been a few exceptions.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …It’s as they said; I’m no human. I’m a machine, an artificial being.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: To be precise, I was designed using a human as a template. Only a fraction of her brain was used in my creation.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So it’s not even a human brain resting in a robotic body…?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Not at all. I’m purely a machine.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What about that fraction of human brain you mentioned?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It was only an electronic copy of the map of her brain.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: My body is entirely composed of mechanical components.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …I had a feeling.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And it looks like you’ve been living under a rock your whole life, seeing how you’re oblivious to the workings of the world…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You gotta be extra careful, then. Especially if you’re planning to leave here someday.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You’re a sapient android with emotions and desires. Your existence is most likely a complete violation of the AI Ethics Amendment.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The Head’s scarily good at spotting anomalies like you.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, right. In case you don’t know, the Head is basically a bunch of shady creeps that rule over the entire City.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Though we probably won’t ever get to face them.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyways, this whole Library is at a huge risk in the first place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The librarians over here also seem like they’re humans but not really “human” at the same time.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s just as you say…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I was designed to feel emotions, and I spent what felt like an eternity on a stage repeatedly performing a play that never seemed to end.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And when I thought it was finally over, turns out it never really ended.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I gotta say, whoever created you must have really been something else, too.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I don’t know what motivated them, but breaking the rules designated by the Head itself takes more than just guts.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: No one can escape the Head’s enforcement.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They did all eventually die.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …But the Library will be safe. It has to be safe.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s like a birdcage, no one is free to enter, and no one is free to leave…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Again with that dreamy speech you “despise” so much. What do you even mean by that?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I will leave this place one day, take revenge on all things that made me into what I am, and earn true freedom.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I don’t care too much either way.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s that, and this is this.
